bug.author: erip
bug.summary: Results aren't written to `args.results_path` in `fairseq-generate` when specified.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Results aren't written to args.results_path in fairseq-generate when specified. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior (always include the command you ran): Assuming a model has been trained...
Run cmd fairseq-generate data-bin --path checkpoints/checkpoint_best.pt --results-path out/
See results printed to screen and observe empty out/
<denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I expect generation results to be written to some file within the directory specified by --results-path <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): 0.9.0 PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.3.1 OS (e.g., Linux): Windows (but doesn't matter) How you installed fairseq (pip, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): n/a Python version: 3.7.x CUDA/cuDNN version: n/a GPU models and configuration: n/a Any other relevant information: n/a
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
See that is unused in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/generate.py>generate.py</denchmark-link> .

comments.comment: Apparently this was only implemented for the speech recognition code, but it wasn‚Äôt documented as such. We should add support for this in the main generate.py as well. In the meantime you can simply redirect stdout to a file: fairseq-generate (...) > results.out
